column4: Hi, I keep getting this error: svn: warning: cannot set LC_CTYPE locale
svn: warning: environment variable LC_CTYPE is UTF-8
svn: warning: please check that your locale name is correct
and I can't get rid of it.
anyone got a clue?
pastebin the output of 'env'
http://pastebin.com/EiUkNBgP
your LC_CTYPE is wrong. try this in the shell: unset LC_CTYPE
this is what is in /etc/environment
that looks ok, must be one of the other files then
LC_CTYPE is not in any of those files
try this in the shell: set -x; . ~/.bashrc > bashrc_out 2>&1
and pastebin the resulting bashrc_out file
http://pastebin.com/QHubWS7B
ok, looks like something did that just once. Can you open a new shell and see what LC_CTYPE is set to there?
LC_CTYPE=UTF-8
grep CTYPE -R /etc
also, grep CTYPE ~/.??*
http://pastebin.com/biFpfmpT
isn't there a way to set this systemwide?
not unless you know where it's set to the wrong value
